subject: Critical Thinking
title: Survivorship Bias: The Silent Evidence Problem
description: A short lesson to help you apply Survivorship Bias: The Silent Evidence Problem.

hook.text: WWII planes returned covered in bullet holes. Engineers planned to armor those spots.

buildup.text: The planes that got hit in other places didn't come back. You only saw survivors â€” not the full picture.

discovery.text: Survivorship bias: we draw conclusions from visible successes and ignore invisible failures.

twist.text: 'Bill Gates dropped out & became a billionaire.' True. Also: millions of dropouts aren't billionaires.

climax.text: Self-help books, startup advice, and success stories all suffer from survivorship bias. The dead don't write memoirs.

punchline.text: Before you copy the winners, count the losers you can't see.

quiz.question: Why did Abraham Wald suggest armoring undamaged areas of planes?
options: Planes hit in those areas didn't survive to be studied
